senses.de: A view or representation of someone or something, especially as seen from the side
senses.ex: The suspects were described to the police using a written profile

Tips.title: Visual Aspect
Tips.description: The term 'profile' often refers to physical appearance from a side view.
Tips.example: The artist captured her profile perfectly.

Tips.title: Not Full Face
Tips.description: A 'profile view' specifically excludes the front or full-face view.
Tips.example: Please turn your head for a profile shot.

senses.de: A description or summary of a person's abilities or achievements
senses.ex: The human resources department created a profile for each employee

Tips.title: Biographical Summary
Tips.description: 'Profile' can summarize a person's skills or history, often used in professional contexts.
Tips.example: The job candidate's profile highlighted her experience.

Tips.title: Impress Profiles Matter
Tips.description: Online profiles should be taken seriously, as they can affect personal and professional opportunities.
Tips.example: He updated his LinkedIn profile to find a job.

Tips.title: Essential Details
Tips.description: A person's 'profile' includes key facts, skipping minor details, much like a highlight reel.
Tips.example: His executive profile focused on his decision-making skills.

senses.de: A outline of something especially as seen from one side
senses.ex: The city has a beautiful profile against the sky

Tips.title: Not Always Physical
Tips.description: 'Profile' describes an outline which can be literal physical shape or a metaphorical concept.

Tips.title: Silhouettes Matter
Tips.description: In design, the 'profile' of objects can be crucial for aesthetic and functional purposes.
Tips.example: The car's sleek profile reduces air resistance.

senses.de: A set of characteristics that identify or are thought to identify a particular type of person
senses.ex: The police have a profile of the likely perpetrator

Tips.title: Behavioral Insights
Tips.description: 'Profile' in psychology helps understand particular behavior patterns or personality types.
Tips.example: Her behavior matched the profile of a confidant individual.

senses.de: To represent in profile or to give a brief description
senses.ex: The magazine profiled the movie star in their latest issue

Tips.title: Exposure Through Writing
Tips.description: To 'profile' someone in writing is to give them attention and reveal their story to others.
Tips.example: The inventor was profiled in a technology magazine.

Characterization.wordDefinition:
Characterization refers to the process of describing or developing a character's personality, behavior, and motivations in a story.

A profile is a brief description of a person's traits or characteristics, while characterization is the way an author develops and presents fictional characters in a story.

Configuration.wordDefinition:
Configuration refers to the settings or arrangement of something, such as a computer system or a device like a router.

Configuration is often used in a technical context to describe how something is set up or formatted.

So the difference between the two words is that configuration is about how something is set up or organized, while profile is about describing a person or an organization.

Configuration is applicable in technical settings, while profile is applicable in social and personal settings.

Contour.wordDefinition:
Contour refers to the outline or shape of an object, especially its surface features, while profile refers to a view of something from the side that shows its outline or shape.

Contour is often used to describe the curves and bumps of natural features like hills, while profile describes the shape of human faces or objects like buildings or machines.

Form.wordDefinition:
Form refers to a document that you fill out with information about yourself or a particular matter, like an application form for a job or a registration form for an event.

The information is usually basic and straightforward.

A profile refers to a more detailed description of a person, place, or thing. It usually includes a variety of information, including personal details, interest, and skills.

This information is often used to create a picture of a person's abilities, background, or identity.

A form is used to gather basic information, while a profile is a more detailed description of a person or situation.

Outline.wordDefinition: Outline refers to a basic sketch or plan of something, usually the general shape or structure without any details. It is applicable in writing an essay or creating a drawing, where you need to organize your thoughts or ideas in a coherent way.

Persona.wordDefinition:
Persona refers to the image that a person presents to others, which may or may not accurately reflect their true personality.

Profile refers to a complete record or summary of someone's personal, professional, or social history. This term is commonly used in online platforms like social media, where users create a profile that includes information about their interests, hobbies, and personal details.

Persona is about how someone acts or behaves, while profile is about what information they share about themselves.

Persona is applicable in understanding others' behaviour in social settings, while profile is applicable in creating an online presence.

Shape.wordDefinition:
Shape is a more general term that can refer to the overall form or structure of something.

This word might be used to describe the appearance of something from all angles, rather than just the side or edge. For example, you might talk about the shape of a building or the shape of a puddle.

Profile is a more specific and detailed term that is often used in technical or artistic contexts, while shape is a more general and versatile term that can be used in a wide range of situations.

Silhouette.wordDefinition:
A silhouette is a dark outline of someone's body, usually simplified to show just the basic shape. This can be used for artistic purposes or to conceal a person's identity.

A profile shows details of a person's features, while a silhouette shows just the basic shape.

quotes.Text: It's very easy for me to keep a low profile because the focus I feel is always on the music. Success and fame are two different things. And so I feel the success is always towards the music, which means that I can have a very normal and private lifestyle.
quotes.Title: Irish Musician
quotes.Name: Enya

quotes.Text: Over the years, I've been trying to build a relationship with an audience. I've tried to maintain as much of a low profile as I could so that those characters would emerge and their relationship with audiences would be protected.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Spacey

quotes.Text: By becoming an MBE, I hope it helps raise the profile of our sector and what a thriving industry it is. I also hope it inspires others entrepreneurs in craft to believe, innovate and put our industry firmly on the map.
quotes.Title: British Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Sara Davies

quotes.Text: The one good thing is that I get a lot more good scripts coming through my letterbox. 'Vera Drake' raised my profile in one way, and then 'Harry Potter' in another.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Imelda Staunton

quotes.Text: I love doing stand-up, and the more you do outside of stand-up to raise your profile, the better your stand-up becomes in terms of the quality of gigs.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Erik Griffin

quotes.Text: It's certainly an honor to have kids who are looking up to me, but at the same time, I'm just trying to do what I can to raise the profile of chess.
quotes.Title: Japanese Celebrity
quotes.Name: Hikaru Nakamura

quotes.Text: I hope I have helped to raise the profile of science and to show that physics is not a mystery but can be understood by ordinary people.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: It was always our aim to raise the profile of the game, and I believe it's only going to get bigger.
quotes.Title: English Athlete
quotes.Name: Toni Duggan

quotes.Text: The ideal 'New Yorker' profile is a person, an interesting person, at a critical point in his life.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Lawrence Wright

quotes.Text: Interviews are good if you want to be an actor because they raise your profile.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jack Gleeson
